definition: to draw to oneself/to gather up/to collect/to fold up (an umbrella, wings etc)/to assemble (a party of persons)/to rope in (some people)
to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)
to gather together/to collect/to approach/to draw near to/to add/to sum up/to comb (hair)

sentences.chinese: 那只鹰收拢双翅做俯冲。

sentences.english: The resource is formatted and highlighted, and arrays and objects can be collapsed.
sentences.chinese: 资源已经格式化并突出显示，可以把数组和对象收拢。

sentences.english: They won’t even go after the FBI agent trying to nail them.
sentences.chinese: 他们甚至不会去跟随想收拢他们的FBI。

sentences.english: Her skirt had bunched up round her waist.
sentences.chinese: 她的裙子在腰际成皱褶收拢。

sentences.english: Our fingers will curl in the positive direction of rotation.
sentences.chinese: 我们的手指将收拢于正旋转方向。

sentences.english: Gather the ends of the wool together and tie them in a knot.
sentences.chinese: 把毛线头都收拢起来，把它们打成一个结。

definition: to gather/to rake together/to pile up
to constrict/to draw tight/to gather (one's thoughts)/to bring to a close/to pack (for a journey)
to flee in disorder/defeated and in rout
to adhere/to attach oneself to/to append
